pages.title: Crushing Petals
pages.text: While crushing flowers seems a bit unorthodox, it $(italic)did$() seem to work. No problem plucking the petals from the flattened blossom after that.

pages.title: Ink from Petals
pages.text: Having studied not only botany but also color theory, you definitely recognize some similarities. The colored flowers, resemble $(l:general/colored_trees)Color Trees$(/l) in more than just one point.$(br2)No wonder that their petals can also be used to create $(l:magic/ink)Ink$(/l).

pages.title: Enchanted Soil
pages.text: Enchanted Soil can be mined using tools enchanted with $(l:enchanting/resonance)Resonance$(/l).

pages.title: Glimmering Flowers
pages.text: Adding some $(l:resources/shimmerstone)Shimmerstone(/l) to magical flowers makes them glimmer.

pages.title: Colored Mushrooms
pages.text: Applying $(l:general/pigment)Pigment$(/l) to mushrooms colors them in the respective color.
Using $(l:general/pigment)Pigment$(/l) instead of mundane Dye when creating $(thing)Floral Fertilizer$() is quite a bit more yielding.
The $(thing)Black Lotus$() is a great source of Mana, no questions asked. But yet, it still can be enhanced. Using some $(thing)Jade Petals$()
Those elusive seeds you could only find in chests hidden around the world? While pricey - maybe not even worth the hassle - you finally found a way to replicate those.

pages.title: New Potion Reagent
pages.text: Infuses the Potion with a huge amount of additional positive as well as negative, effects, but it's black color also makes it completely unidentifiable. What might you get?

pages.title: New Potion Reagent
pages.text: Infuses the Potion with a huge amount of additional - mostly positive - effects, but it's black color also makes it completely unidentifiable. What might you get?

pages.title: New Potion Reagent
pages.text: Makes your Potions much more potent, but at a huge loss of duration. If the duration will get too short the potion might end up useless altogether...

pages.title: New Potion Reagent
pages.text: Gives a small multiplicative boost to Duration and a tiny chance to add the last brewed effect, too.

pages.title: New Potion Reagent
pages.text: Converts the Potions into Lingering Potions as a single reagent. This way it allows you to directly create Tipped Arrows, too!
